title: Blue and white footed cup

  physical_appearance: This is a blue white footed cup whose exterior body is painted with a rich cobalt blue in a cracked ice pattern. Its angularity juxtaposes the curvature of the plum blossoms.  Encircling the lower rim of its stouted stem is a jagged teeth pattern.

  subject_terms_1: porcelain paintings (visual works) asymmetry (composition concept) flower (motif) freehand drawings (drawings) symbolism

  subject_terms_4: 

  context_1: The dish was exhibited in the Exhibition of Chinese Blue-and-White Ceramics exhibition held at the National Museum of Singapore in April 1978. It is featured as number 156 in the exhibition catalogue. They are featured as number 284 in the exhibition catalogue.

  context_8: curators planners

  sgcool_label_text: This cup is decorated with plum blossoms on a blue
 cracked ice pattern () ground. The cracked-ice pattern gained popularity as a decorative motif in seventeenth-century China and was appreciated for its beautiful asymmetry. On porcelain vessels
 the pattern is often coupled with the plum blossom
 which was regarded as a symbol of strength and endurance since the flower blooms in late winter or early spring.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This cup is decorated with plum blossoms on a blue, cracked ice pattern () ground. The cracked-ice pattern gained popularity as a decorative motif in seventeenth-century China and was appreciated for its beautiful asymmetry. On porcelain vessels, the pattern is often coupled with the plum blossom, which was regarded as a symbol of strength and endurance since the flower blooms in late winter or early spring.
